episodeTitle: I Swear to Go See Him!! Brook and the Cape of Promise!
episodeTitleJapanese: 必ず会いに行く！！ブルックと約束の岬
episodeTitleRomanized: Kanarazu Ai ni Iku!! Burukku to Yakusoku no Misaki
description: The Straw Hats share their encounter with Laboon to the crew, while Brook battles Ryuma and reflects on his 50-year-old promise to reunite with the whale. Luffy announces his determination to recruit Brook as their musician.

events.title: Straw Hats Recount Meeting Laboon
events.description: Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, and Usopp tell Franky, Chopper, Robin, and the others about their encounter with the giant whale Laboon at Twin Capes. They explain how Laboon has been waiting 50 years for his crew to return.
events.significance: Establishes the connection between the Straw Hats' earlier journey and Brook's backstory, creating emotional weight for why Brook must join the crew.

quotes.text: That whale... Laboon is still waiting for his friends to come back!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Explaining Laboon's 50-year vigil to the crew members who weren't there

events.title: Laboon's Story Told to Full Crew
events.description: The crew learns the full story of Laboon: how he waited at Reverse Mountain for the Rumbar Pirates, how Crocus cared for him, and how Luffy promised to come back for a rematch after painting his Jolly Roger on Laboon's head.
events.significance: Connects Brook's tragic past with the Straw Hats' journey, showing the crew that Laboon is still alive and waiting.

quotes.text: Laboon kept ramming his head into the Red Line for 50 years, waiting for his crew!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Describing Laboon's devotion to his lost crew

events.title: Brook vs Ryuma Battle Continues
events.description: Brook continues his intense duel with the zombie samurai Ryuma, who possesses Brook's stolen shadow. Despite being outmatched, Brook refuses to give up.
events.significance: Demonstrates Brook's determination and fighting spirit as he battles for his shadow and his future.

quotes.text: I cannot afford to lose here! I made a promise!
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's determination during the battle with Ryuma

events.title: Ryuma Cuts Brook's Afro
events.description: During their battle, Ryuma manages to slice through Brook's iconic afro with his sword, cutting away part of what Brook considers essential to his identity and promise to Laboon.
events.significance: A devastating moment that strikes at Brook's core identity - his afro is the only thing Laboon would recognize him by after 50 years. Despite this, Brook continues fighting.

quotes.text: My afro! That's the only thing Laboon would recognize me by!
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's anguish as his afro is damaged in battle

events.title: Brook Remembers Meeting Baby Laboon
events.description: Brook recalls the first time the Rumbar Pirates met Laboon, a lost baby whale. The crew cheered him up with music, and Brook named him 'Laboon.' The whale became like family to them.
events.significance: Reveals the origin of Brook and Laboon's bond, showing why this promise means everything to Brook even after 50 years.

quotes.text: We found this little whale all alone and sad. So we played music for him, and he started following us!
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's memory of first meeting Laboon

events.title: Brook's Afro as Symbol of Promise
events.description: In flashback, the Rumbar Pirates note that Brook's afro resembles Laboon's shape. Brook's afro becomes a symbol of his humanity and the only feature Laboon would recognize after Brook ate the Yomi Yomi no Mi and became a skeleton.
events.significance: Explains why Brook is so protective of his afro - it's not vanity, but the last remnant of his former appearance that his dear friend would recognize.

quotes.text: Your hair looks just like Laboon!
quotes.speaker: Rumbar Pirate
quotes.context: A crewmate commenting on the similarity between Brook's afro and Laboon's head

events.title: Brook Vows to Return to Laboon
events.description: Despite being wounded and losing his afro in battle with Ryuma, Brook makes a solemn vow that he will survive and return to Laboon, no matter what it takes.
events.significance: Demonstrates Brook's unwavering commitment to his promise despite seemingly impossible odds and 50 years of waiting.

quotes.text: I will definitely go see him! I will return to Laboon, even if it costs me my life!
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's determined vow during his battle with Ryuma

events.title: Ryuma Stabs Brook
events.description: Ryuma delivers a devastating strike to Brook, stabbing him through the torso as Brook continues to fight despite his injuries.
events.significance: Shows the desperate stakes of Brook's battle and his willingness to risk everything for his promise.

events.title: Franky Cries Over Laboon's Story
events.description: Upon hearing the full story of Laboon waiting 50 years for his crew, the emotional Franky breaks down in tears, deeply moved by the whale's loyalty and Brook's dedication.
events.significance: Provides emotional catharsis and shows how Brook's story resonates with the Straw Hats, proving he belongs with them.

quotes.text: That's so beautiful! A whale waiting 50 years for his friends!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky's emotional response to hearing about Laboon

events.title: Luffy Declares Brook Will Join the Crew
events.description: After hearing about Brook's connection to Laboon and his 50-year promise, Luffy excitedly declares his absolute determination to make Brook their crew's musician. This time, the entire crew agrees without objection.
events.significance: A pivotal moment where Brook is unanimously accepted as a future Straw Hat crew member, cementing his place in the crew.

quotes.text: That settles it! Brook is going to be our musician! We're getting him on our crew no matter what!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's excited declaration after learning about Brook's promise to Laboon

events.title: Sanji's Determination to Stop Absalom
events.description: Sanji becomes furiously determined to stop Absalom's forced wedding to Nami, his anger reaching a boiling point at the thought of the ceremony.
events.significance: Sets up Sanji's personal motivation for the upcoming battle and his confrontation with Absalom.

quotes.text: I won't let that creep marry Nami-swan! I'll stop that wedding no matter what!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's furious determination to rescue Nami

events.title: Straw Hats Prepare for Counterattack
events.description: The Straw Hat crew makes the collective decision to launch a full counterattack on Thriller Bark to reclaim their stolen shadows and rescue their captured crewmates.
events.significance: Marks the transition from reconnaissance to all-out assault on Gecko Moria's forces, beginning the climax of the Thriller Bark arc.

quotes.text: Let's go get our shadows back and save our friends!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy rallying the crew for their counterattack

events.title: To Be Continued Gag - Usopp's Reluctance
events.description: In the end-of-episode gag, Usopp tries to back out of leaving the ship to fight zombies, but Sanji angrily forces him to follow the group.
events.significance: Provides comedic relief while showing character dynamics and Usopp's cowardly nature contrasted with his loyalty.

quotes.text: Wait, do I really have to go fight zombies again?!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's comedic attempt to avoid danger

quotes.text: I will definitely go see him! I will return to Laboon, even if it costs me my life!
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's vow during battle with Ryuma

quotes.text: That settles it! Brook is going to be our musician! We're getting him on our crew no matter what!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: My afro! That's the only thing Laboon would recognize me by!
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's anguish when Ryuma cuts his afro

themes.description: The episode centers on Brook's unwavering 50-year commitment to reunite with Laboon, demonstrating that true promises transcend time and even death itself.
themes.symbolism: Brook's afro symbolizes his promise - it's the last thing connecting him to his past life and the only way Laboon would recognize him.

themes.description: Both Laboon's loyalty to the Rumbar Pirates and the Straw Hats' acceptance of Brook showcase the series' core theme that true bonds never fade.
themes.symbolism: The parallel between Laboon waiting for Brook and the Straw Hats waiting to help Brook represents the power of genuine companionship.

themes.description: Brook's fear that Laboon won't recognize him as a skeleton, and his desperate protection of his afro, explores themes of identity persistence despite physical transformation.
themes.symbolism: The afro represents continuity of self and the bridge between who Brook was and who he is now.

characterSpotlights.development: Brook's character deepens as we see his internal struggle between despair and hope, and his absolute determination to honor his promise despite impossible odds.
keyActions: Continues fighting Ryuma despite being outmatched
Loses his afro to Ryuma's sword
Recalls memories of meeting baby Laboon
Vows to return to Laboon no matter what
Gets stabbed by Ryuma but refuses to give up
quotes: I will definitely go see him! I will return to Laboon, even if it costs me my life!
My afro! That's the only thing Laboon would recognize me by!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's immediate understanding of Brook's situation and his enthusiastic determination to help Brook fulfill his promise shows his growth as a captain who values his crew's dreams.
keyActions: Tells the crew about meeting Laboon
Declares absolute determination to recruit Brook
Rallies crew for counterattack on Thriller Bark
quotes: That settles it! Brook is going to be our musician! We're getting him on our crew no matter what!

characterSpotlights.development: Franky's emotional reaction to Brook's story demonstrates his sentimental nature and how he's already bonding with potential new crewmates.
keyActions: Breaks down crying over the emotional tale
quotes: That's so beautiful! A whale waiting 50 years for his friends!

mangaDifferences.difference: A significant portion of this episode consists of archive footage from Episode 62, recycling the original Laboon introduction sequence. This was anime-original padding not present in the manga.
The extended flashback showing the Rumbar Pirates with baby Laboon was expanded in the anime for emotional impact, while the manga kept it briefer.
The 'To Be Continued' gag with Usopp trying to avoid going to fight zombies was an anime-original addition for comedy.

trivia.fact: This episode heavily recycles footage from Episode 62, making it one of the most flashback-heavy episodes in the Thriller Bark arc.
Episode 354 adapts only pages 13-19 of Chapter 459, making it one of the slower-paced episodes in terms of manga coverage.
The eyecatcher for this episode features Robin and Chopper, as noted in the episode's production details.
Chō voices both Brook and Ryuma in the Japanese version, meaning he was essentially acting against himself during the battle scenes.
This episode achieved an 8.4% TV rating in Japan and ranked 7th in viewership for its timeslot.
